body:
It would be great if `highlight.pack.js` and `highlight.pack.min.js` were included in the NPM distribution.

Some reasons to do this:
1. Bower [has been having some issues](http://bower.io/blog/2015/bower-alive-looking-contributors/) and it's not entirely clear what its future is.
2. The highlight.js bower component [isn't always updated](https://github.com/components/highlightjs/releases) when there are new releases. (It's missing 9.3.0 at the moment.) The NPM package is updated more reliably.
3. Many other frontend packages publish their build artifacts via NPM. For example, if you `npm install jquery`, you'll get `node_modules/jquery/dist/jquery.min.js` and friends.
